greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of psi(-x) * f(-x)^3 in powers of x where psi(), f() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/4) * eta(q)^4 * eta(q^4) / eta(q^2) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (128 t)) = 2^(19/2) (t/i)^2 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A215596.
a(n) = (-1)^floor( n/2 ) * b(4*n + 1) where b() is multiplicative with b(2^e) = 0^e, b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 * (-p)^(e/2) if p == 3 (mod 4),
mathematica: A215597[n_] := SeriesCoefficient[(QPochhammer[x]^4 * QPochhammer[x^4])/ QPochhammer[x^2], {x, 0, n}]; Table[A215597[n], {n, 0, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 01 2017 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^4 * eta(x^4 + A) / eta(x^2 + A), n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Aug 16 2012
